column5: One more sleep (hopefully 8:00pm to 03:00 am ) then up and at 'em to meet Big Cliff (head chef of the Tyler G2G) @ 04:45 am (I can just imagine Jack (Nanook) shaking his head in disbelief)  see y'all in the morning...don't forget your helmets and boots...  Nice try Terry...LOL
I'll be thawing the chicken breasts tonight.  Remember they are FULLY cooked, so just heat and serve tomorrow.  This should save the grill grunts lots of time  Tony

Stopped by the park on the way home .Looks like we have lost our set up spot we had last year at the ramp ( Lot F?) as a mini midway has been set up there Should be able to set up at the edge of the adjoining lot ,but for anyone coming late rin the morning parking may be tough . TB  btw I'll throw a garbage can and bags into the trailer tonight . I can dispose of our garbage on Monday at work .
let me see what I can do for the buns Cliff
Calvin...you do the foot work to go buy the buns/bring them to the G2G and I'll reimburse you for their cost when I see you at the G2G'r. How's that sound?
Long range forecast for the GTG is +4 on Saturday! Hope that holds true, ice fishin in above zero temps is ideal! HH
Yep...the temps may just get bly and I and the kids out on that day.  We haven't confirmed because it's all weather dependent for us.

Today's message brought to you by the number eight!  As in... 8L of BBQ sauce and 8L of Ketchup! When I went to pick up the sauces, I was happy to see that E.D. Smith took care of our needs for the Tyler G2G  I believe we will have enough of these 2 sauces to feed the masses.  Cheers, Tony
Now that's a lot of sauce!!!  Way to go E.D. Smith!!!  Maureen
Way to go Kelvin, you have a reply...lol  Maureen
hello all is anyone heading to the g2g from london.looking for a ride thanks jamie

Wish I could be there but I have other commitments.  Glad to see you at the show Mo and I hope that all goes well.  I am glad that some of my sponsors donated some great prizes.  Cheers let me know how it all goes and I can't wait for the reports.  Kudos to all that are donating or being apart of this great event.

Gettin close folks !!  Weather looks good and heres hoping there is a good crowd.  Planning to drop by tomorrow to check conditions ( parking lot , ice conditions  etc) will forward pics tomorrow night.  From what I hear some awesome prizes up for grabs as well  Tinbanger
Thanks Dave....wondering if snowshoes might be a good idea considering this warm crap we're havin.
I'm bit worried about the slush ,last I heard the 4 wheelers were having a tough go of it. Maybe we will all be perch fishing !

The temps are dropping to -12C tonight, so it should tighten up the slush.  Dave, what time on Friday will you be at the site.  I have to meet the the Honey wagon and set up our porta-potti, maybe we'll cross or can meet.  my cell (705) 717-4557

For those who would like to attend, BUT, do not have ice fishing tackle.  I will have 5 rod and reel combos and a manual auger with me on Saturday. I will not be fishing, and anyone without can enjoy the outing by borrowing mine.  I will also post this on the general board.  John

I'm heading out of downtown/east end of Toronto to the GTG, anticipating arriving at around 6:30am. I have an open seat for the ride up and back for anyone who needs one. I don't expect any re-imbursment, just offering someone without wheels, a ride up. PM me if your interested! HH

These posts are great - I enjoy the spirit on this board.  Sometimes we all work at fishing, sometimes we all work at another goal, like Motiv8tr's Tyler program.  One person  really can make a difference; you are a great model for us all, Maureen.  I am looking forward to meeting all youse folks, fer sure.  Shame on the no shows, like Roy, for e.g.

That's ok douG....Roy will be with us monetary wise and in spirit !!!  I threw a couple of old wooden tip-ups in my pail in case some newbie cares to try their hand at icefishing this license free weekend...
Okay I need a quick response to this as we're out of the office after 12:30 today.  I just talked the boss into a donation and I need to know who to make the cheque out to.  Thanks,  Joey
I'll see if I can find my cancelled cheque from last year Joey and get back to you.   "Elisa and Terry French"
Thanks Wayne  Joey
Canadian Alcona Social  Home  or for short just make it out to... "CASH"..... and give it to me.I will look after it....LOL
Too funny Terry! See you in the am !
Looking forward to seeing everyone tomorrow.

I know this was mentioned on another thread but as our M&G is on the Saturday of license free family weekend it might be a good time to bring a friend who has expressed an interest in icefishing but needs a license...I'm sure most of us will have extra equipment that we could lend them to get a "hands on" feel of what it is all about...

Maureen: With the Winterfest will we still be able to drive to the parking lot by the ramp within the park or will they shut the park down to vechicle traffic? It would really s*ck if we had to walk & pull all our equipment from god knows where. Beans: I can not agree more. I'll bring some extra equipment just in case.  Best Wishes: Rick

Hey Rick, the road to the parking lots including the one near the ramp are open, but it is first come first server for a spot .  Winterfest was held on the same weekend as our first G2G and we had no problems.  Maureen
Don't forget thats the "License Free Ice Fishing Weekend!!!   dsn
well tinbanger my brother and I will probly be there for sure, it was a great time last year. i encourege everyone that is thinking of going to go for it, it is a great time.
If anyone's going to the event from Parry Sound, Pointe au Baril area let me know, I have no transportation but it sounds like a worthwhile cause and a fun time. Give me a PM.
I've got a Daiwa Rod&Reel combo as well as some other misc. fishing related stuff for the prize table!  Tony
trying to see what I can setup in the way of Hot dogs & buns as well as the hot choc & cups.. Will let you know. Have 20lb Propane tank, tower & hose for 2 BBQs ready to go

Hey Loonie... If I can help you with some hotdogs and buns... or even hotchocolate, let me know... dang.. to bad I hadn't have been thinking of this sooner, my motherinlaw would have helped us out with the cups... she was beggin for someone to put them to good use... next year forsure, but for now, let me know if I can help with the rest....  Safe fishing First  Lady...

Hey all, hold off on the dogs and such for now.  I talked to the manager of Sobey's today and he is going to donate some food and stuff.  I should hear from him in the next day or so as to how much they will donate.  What they don't donate outright we will be able to get at cost.  Maureen
thanks Shelly will let you know  Mo  let me know because one of the stores here has a special on hot dogs right now so let me know soon PLS
HI  I would like to attend as well,  any chance on getting a ride, i live in TO (high park).  will to help with expences..  Dave
DMASSE l got yah was going to ask you anyhow maybe it will be this time. peace

I'll be coming up from the east end of Toronto and I'll be driving. Planning on heading back to the big smoke around 2:00pm. If anyone from the east end needs a ride, let me know, I have room for one person and their gear. HH PS... I'm for the moment assuming that the cold weather of late, will have added some inches to the existing ice. Can we drive out from there, ie the ramp, assuming the ice is thick enough?

Sausages, sausages, sausages.  They were by far the most popular item last year.  Mild & medium.  Anyone got a lead on some?  Tonyb, sorry you may have posted on the # of chicken breasts you will be bringing and I've missed it. Do you know yet how many?

Hey guys!  I picked up the desert bars and chicken breasts last night.  I'll be getting the BBQ sauce and Ketchup this weekend as well so you can scratch those items off the list.  Chicken breasts are big, full size actually and there are between 100-125.  I think a regular hamburger bun will be too small for these, so keep that in mind.  Probably a larger Kaiser style bun will work better.  Desert bars - WOW!  They gave me a sampler of their products, here is what is listed on their website:  Traditional Nanaimo Bars, Rich Deep Dutch Brownies, Tripleberry Crumble, Lemonburst Macaroon and the innovative tiger striped Triple Chocolate Chunk Brownie  Sauces - BBQ Sauce and Ketchup enough for the day (I will confirm the quantity when I pick it up to make sure it will last the whole day)  Getting excited now, only 14 more sleeps!  Tony

innovative tiger striped Triple Chocolate Chunk Brownie[/b]  Those are mine all mine...I want them all  :w00t:   lol  Tony that's great, as soon as I hear back from Sobey's I will post it.  Actually I will try to give a call this afternoon.  They did say that if I needed more than they were able to donate, they would provide it at cost, so that will help.  Maureen
Thanks Tony, that's a BIG help.  Buns, anyone got a lead on where we might be able to get some buns donated?

Hey guys, I will be there.... and might bring a few OFC'rs with me.. is there anything you are short of that I might be able to help with?  See you guys there!  Anyone interested in a carpool?   Gerritt.
I think we are still waiting on Moe to find out what Sobye's is going to donate so we can figure out what else is still needed.
Sorry guys, darn work, I am home today so I will call Sobey's and see what they have to say....stay tuned  Maureen

Hey all, I talked to the manager at Sobey's, not what I was hoping for but better than nothing.  They will give us the hotdogs and buns for free, and will give us everything else we need at cost.  I think that's a good deal and we should take advantage of it.  I am on vacation next week and am able to go down there, or it can be picked up the morning of the G2G.  All I need to do is give him a call a couple of days ahead of my going down with a list of what I will be getting so he can have it all together when I get there.  So, what do we need?  Hamburgers, buns, Kaiser type buns for Chicken breasts, sausages and buns and condiments...now Cliff is this too much?  maybe leave the sausages out in place of the chicken???  I dunno, that's why I left the BBQ to you  , you make the tough calls ...lol  Let me know and we'll go from there  Maureen
i'll be heading up from the highpark area so if anyone needs a lift shoot me a pm, if i clean out the back seat, i'll have room for 2.. mike

How is this for a deal Moe. You get the sausages 100 ea. and what ever doesen't sell I'll buy for cost + 10%. You (Tyler) can't loose! I do remember when we started last year thinking "Sausages?" but they were the biggest hit! so now we need buns!
Ok people, who will be the first to step up to the plate; 200 jumbo hotdog buns, get them donated, buy them, have we got any salesmen (people) on this board?

Well it's beginning to look like we might get some ice after all, not that I would have cancelled this great event  .  I think this year will be bigger and better, I can feel it in my bones....or is that the cold  3rd annual Fishing for Tyler Get together.  Tyler French is ten years old, lives in Alcona ON and is autistic.  We are holding our third annual ice fishing fund raiser/G2G on Sat February 24th, 2007 at the Innisfil Beach Park boat launch, to help raise money for Tyler’s much needed ABA, speech, and other therapies. This year we are hoping to raise enough money to help Tyler get a special bike so that he can develop more physically as well as share in a family activity of riding bikes together for the first time.   Time: 7:00am check in, last fish measured at 1:00pm, prizes to follow . Cost: 16 and over, $10.00min., under 16 no charge, but donations gratefully accepted.  Pizes: 1st, 2nd and 3rd for the longest Perch, and the same for the longest Whitefish/Laker , with a draw following.  To get there, take Hwy 400, or Yonge St. to the 8th line (Innisfil Beach Rd.), Go East on Innisfil Beach Rd, to the end, turn left into the park, follow the rd. to the right, past the snack bar to the boat launch.  Once again we will have the BBQ going at full steam, and hot drinks available, and hopefully a return of the Port-a-Potty. This year it looks like we will have a couple of special guests as well, but I'll wait until I get more info on that  i can't find my copy of the map, but it is on the earlier thread.  I will create another thread regarding the prize table.  Looking forward to seeing all of you this year.  Maureen
Had a great time last year & I am planning on being there this year again. Will bring a prize again also( first/aid kit). Hope to see lots out there.  Best Wishes: Rick
Count me in Maureen
I seem to remember having a good time the last time.. so I will be there   time to take that big trout out of the freezer again...lol
You crack me up Terry  Joey
Maureen asked me to post the maps again, so here they are.
This is in febuary right? What is the date?  Hope to make it up there also.
Read the first post, Nauti.

If I am not in FLorida I am going to make it
Currently, I am booked to be in North Bay that weekend, but if it falls through, count me in.  I'll let some people know for sure, being from Barrie we're not far away and its for a good cause.
I'll be there with some prizes.

If anyone needs a ride up from this side of the gta from in between portdover and Toro send me a pm. I should be there and have room for five people.  Mo i will also be bringing some stuff for the prize table.
i'll be there
Anyone needing a ride from Lindsay let me know, I have room for 3 people. 328-0750  I too will have something for the prize table Moe. I'll send you a PM after I get back home.
Save me a seat Cliff...
You have your name on one Beans

I plan on attending.  I will get a solid answer on getting some food for the bbq as well as possible deserts.  Maybe even something for the prize table  Hopefully I can drag along some buddies as well to help support the cause.  Tony
Thanks Tony! Let us know as soon as you can about the food, we ran out last year and don't want that to happen again. Just let us know what you can supply then we can work from there.  Thanks  Cliff
Just so you all know, Innisfil will be holding their Winterfest at the same time, so we should have lots more people, and some fun stuff for the kids as well.  Maureen

Is that likely to cause any problems with us having food available Moe? Just wondering is they will have venders there who might get upset that we are giving it away free (donations much appreciated). Also, does that mean that the washrooms will be open?

Cliff last time they just had a chip wagon there. You guys are having a G2G,this means a party.Nothing to do with them,It,s a park for all to use. BBQ away I say.I think your donation  is a great idea.Where else can you get a dog or burger for a buck.

Hey Cliff, no problems at all...I have been in touch with the organizer for Winterfest and he is fully supportive of us, and hopes that having Winterfest on the same weekend will help us raise more money.  As for the washrooms being open, I still need to confirm that.  Maureen

I should be able to attend again this year and will see about adding something to the prize table.  Working on getting my ice palace ready in time for the grand event.  Will be great to see everyone again.
